title: FDA Holds Off Approval of New Merck Arthritis Drug
description: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Merck   Co. on Friday said U.S.  regulators won't approve its experimental arthritis drug  Arcoxia until the company provides more data showing it is safe  and effective.

title: US Airways seeks order to prohibit walkouts
description: US Airways Group Inc. will seek a court injunction to prohibit a strike by disaffected unions that have threatened a walkout if a bankruptcy judge grants the airline's request to cancel their labor contracts.

title: Shortage of steel forces halt at Nissan
description: TOKYO Nissan Motor said on Thursday that a shortage of steel would force it to halt production temporarily at three of its four auto factories in Japan, a highly unusual step the company said was made necessary in part by a surge in demand for steel from

title: Court Upholds RIM Patent Infringement, Sends Case Back for Further <b>...</b>
description: The three-year patent dispute between BlackBerry device maker Research In Motion Ltd. and patent holding company NTP Inc. isn #39;t over yet.

title: Sprint backs Apple tech for video streaming
description: Cell carrier certifies QuickTime format for delivering video to handsets.

title: Macromedia launches Flex Builder
description: Macromedia will ship Flex Builder this week, which is designed to provide an interactive development environment for the company #39;s Flex presentation server.

title: Cell phones increasingly vulnerable to hackers
description: Early this month, several Web sites began offering software promising ringtones and screensavers for certain cell phones. But those who downloaded the software

title: Hurricane Frances Grows Quickly in Atlantic (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Hurricane Frances gained strength and\became a major hurricane with 115 mph winds in the Atlantic on\Friday as it took a path that should carry it north of the\vulnerable northeastern Caribbean islands early next week.

title: Illinois Governor wants to Ban Violent Video games
description: Yesterday Illinois Gov. Rod Blagojevich proposed a state law that would ban the selling and rental of violent and or sexually explicit video games to Children under the age of 18.

title: NBA Wrap: Heat Tame Bobcats to Extend Winning Streak (Reuters)
description: Reuters - Dwyane Wade poured in 26 points and\dished out nine assists as the Miami Heat scorched the\expansion Charlotte Bobcats 113-90 in NBA action on Saturday,\to extend their franchise record win streak to 14 games.

title: Today's schedule
description: College basketball: Men -- Hofstra at Dartmouth, 7 p.m. Pro basketball: Utah vs. Celtics at the FleetCenter, 7:30 p.m.

title: Suzuki sets record but would rather have playoff spot Anaheim #39;s <b>...</b>
description: (CP) - Ichiro Suzuki has the single-season hits record, but he #39;d much rather have the playoff spot Bartolo Colon and the Anaheim Angels are one game closer to securing.

title: Falcons release Whitfield, make seven other moves
description: Flowery Branch, GA (Sports Network) - Atlanta released offensive tackle Bob Whitfield and made seven other moves Sunday to reach the 53-man roster limit.

title: Villeneuve to test for Renault
description: Canadian former world champion Jacques Villeneuve will test for Renault at Silverstone on Wednesday and Thursday, the Formula One team said.

title: Chile to Pay Torture Victims
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, Nov. 28 -- President Ricardo Lagos of Chile on Sunday proposed special pensions and other reparations for more than 28,000 Chileans who were tortured by government agents during the country's 1973-1990 military dictatorship.

title: Task Force Olympia soldier dies of wounds suffered in car bombing
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq A US soldier assigned to Task Force Olympia has died of wounds suffered in a car bomb attack in the northern city of Mosul.

title: British anti-terrorism police arrest radical cleric Abu Hamza
description: British police Thursday arrested radical Muslim cleric Abu Hamza al-Masri under the Terrorism Act at a prison in southeast London where the cleric was already jailed under a US extradition warrant.

title: #39;Suicide #39; theory over train crash
description: LONDON, England -- Police investigating a train crash in southern England in which seven people died are focusing on a theory that a driver parked a car on the rails in an attempt to commit suicide.

title: Killer shark  #39;will be destroyed #39;
description: A great white shark which killed a teenage surfer should be hunted down and destroyed, officials say. But the dead boy #39;s father has said he doesn #39;t want the creature to be killed.
